page.title: 02River Annan
page.content: { Annan}is a small town.It has a population of just over nine thousand. It is on the coast of the {SOLWAY FIRTH.}The{River Annan}flows to the sea by the western edge of the town. You do not have to walk far up the riverside to be completely out of sight of the town. There is a lot of wildlife. We saw red campion, buttercups, ragged robin, daisies, dandelions, goose grass, lapwings, sparrows, sycamore, ash, oak, beech, foxglove, pied, wagtail, mallard and her chicks, chaffinch, long-tailed tits, nettles, red deadnettle, frogspit and grubs. There are two footbridges on this stretch of the river - the Cuthbertson Memorial Bridge and the Queen Victoria Diamond Jubilee Bridge, a suspension bridge built in 1897.
